@himanshug @gianm could you please take a look?
@leventov i'll take a look now

> I think so. It would be less code to refactor as it seems like the AppenderatorDriver implementation keeps changing.

Yeah, that is definitely an advantage. The internals are still evolving but the interface should be relatively more stable.

> I'll work on this in the coming weeks.
> 
> Does that timeline work?

Sure, that sounds good to me!

Hello , 

Recently we have upgraded druid to latest version form 0.9.1.1 to druid-0.10.1. And we too are facing the same issue. Our time series query and topN query used to wok previously but after upgrading , same issue is coming on broker side. For workaround , we haven't upgraded broker and everything is working as normal. But can you please tell us what the issue might be and how can we fix it. Exception  from broker is 
{
    "error": "Unknown exception",
    "errorMessage": "DefaultQueryMetrics must not be modified from multiple threads. If it is needed to gather dimension or metric information from multiple threads or from an async thread, this information should explicitly be passed between threads (e. g. using Futures), or this DefaultQueryMetrics's ownerThread should be reassigned explicitly",
    "errorClass": "java.lang.IllegalStateException",
    "host": null
}
Whole exception on the broker can be found at : https://jpst.it/180vD

@hamlet-lee @licl2014 there have been some commits recently that should make things work better in non-UTC server timezones. They are in 0.11.0 if you want to give the release candidate a shot: http://druid.io/downloads.html
@Igosuki could you add a test please?
@carlez you probably need to increase `-XX:MaxDirectMemorySize`.

@skyler-tao I believe the http inventory view introduced in master recently deals with this better. It waits some time for the view to be initialized. I'm not sure if the ZK based one has been improved since 0.9.2.
@pjain1 thanks! reviewing this now
I'm reviewing this now.
yes, you are right .. thanks. I'll fix it.
good to know that someone is trying out the http based segment management :)
Fixed by #3873 (in groupBy v2).
@leventov @b-slim does this patch need any further review or is it ready to commit?

Just to update this thread that the problem seems to be solved, didn't have a failed task for a few days. However I made 3 changes in parallel, so not entirely sure yet which ones were actually required -
1. Increased the map/reduce Java heap limit (as suggested by @jdlzy), 10g didn't work for me, I'm now using 1g for map and 3g for reduce.
2. Reduced the number of concurrent Hadoop tasks that I'm submitting
3. Enabled hashed partitioning (targetPartitionSize)
OK, i resolved this issue. Format should be:  "format": "y-M-d-H:m:s"

@gianm  - Hello , it was mentioned earlier that "Would it make sense to disable the check for JDBC?" is this JDBC check disabling something we can do in the config files? Or if not, a java patch we can apply on top of 0.10.1. If so we can apply it and test it out prior final fix.
I'm dumb, nevermind
Nothing known that comes to mind. What ingestion method are you using (realtime node, tranquility, kafka indexing, etc)?

Hi @klamouri, I'm not aware of this issue being reported before. I think there are a number of people doing hadoop ingestion successfully with 0.11.0-rc2 though. Maybe they are all using the index_hadoop task. It could be some difference in classloading between the task and the cli version.

When I look at the distro I see a few files that are other versions of curator. Maybe there is a mismatch of some sort:

```
hadoop-dependencies/hadoop-client/2.7.3/curator-client-2.7.1.jar
hadoop-dependencies/hadoop-client/2.7.3/curator-framework-2.7.1.jar
hadoop-dependencies/hadoop-client/2.7.3/curator-recipes-2.7.1.jar
```

@klamouri what happens if you remove these files? Or try using the task instead of the cli?

@himanshug (or someone else with relevant experience) could you please comment on how you have been running 0.11.0 with hadoop?
We are using a realtime node ingesting from kafka using the kafka-0.8 firehose.
Ah, I'm not sure what might be going on there. Do you have a full stack trace?

@Saurabh111191 the issue you reported is different from one from the one reported in this issue. You aren't using Druid SQL (it's the normal QueryResource). I think the issue you're running into is with the chunkPeriod setting. For reasons mentioned in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4004#issuecomment-284171911, chunkPeriod is not typically useful anyway and I've been considering pushing for its removal. In light of what it actually does, do you think you really need it? If not then I'd suggest turning it off.

I raised https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/5128 for the bug you ran into.
I think this is the same issue as #4826.

@ssainz It's not something that can be done in the config files. I'm not sure what the best way would be to make the change in the code. One possibility is to have some way to disable the QueryMetrics thread checking for JDBC (trusting the JDBC server code to do the right thing without needing the check). Another is to provide some way for DruidStatement in the JDBC server to set the QueryMetrics ownerThread when it interacts with the yielder under a lock.

@ssainz @guangyy Could you please paste a stack trace of when you see this exception and also the SQL you ran when you got this error?

@jon-wei @gianm  i have a doubt that long/float dimensions will cause high Cardinality  easily when we have a group by query.so have we consider this scenario?

Thank you for the contribution @soursop can you explain a little more why this cannot be accomplished in an extension?

New features to core druid are reasonable, but changing things in `api/` are dangerous in the long run, and if possible it is good to be able to do things in extensions, even if they get adopted into core druid.
@AlexanderSaydakov please comment when this is ready for another round of review. This looks like a very useful feature.
Note that if you do a `PasswordProvider` for your aws secret, then you don't have to print anything delicate in logs. Also hadoop should be able to pull from classpath site xml's

In our case we have custom hadoop client jars deployed independent of druid based on hadoop version on our hadoop grids, but that is very much same as open source hadoop except for some Yahoo-isms.

We use HadoopIndexTask , and druid process classpath  looks like "druid core jars , druid conf, hadoop jars"
we also add following properties to druid config...

druid.indexer.task.defaultHadoopCoordinates=[]
druid.extensions.addExtensionsToHadoopContainer=true
druid.indexer.fork.property.hadoop.mapreduce.job.classloader=true
druid.extensions.hadoopContainerDruidClasspath="druid core jars, druid conf"

above setup works fine for all my users. hope that helps.

I believe it is ready. I addressed the last two points: NilColumnValueSelector instead of null and throwing exceptions instead of providing dummy comparators

@licl2014 it could happen, although in that case Druid will do the best it can. If cardinality is not super high it should be fine and go quickly. If cardinality is super high then Druid will spill to disk as needed (assuming disk spilling is enabled).
@AlexanderSaydakov thanks for the update. I'll finish my review soon.

@AlexanderSaydakov the latest change looks good to me. Would you please add some documents for these new aggregators? Please see https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/docs/content/development/extensions-core/datasketches-aggregators.md as an example. Also please add this new extension to the core extensions list [here](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/docs/content/development/extensions.md#core-extensions).
@b-slim is there any reference doc how to define the path, I was trying to use HDFS to push the segment. However, I noticed if I mention hdfs it uses segmentOutputPath from hdfs config.

Thanks gianm for the wonderful suggestion. Even I was not entirely happy with the boolean conditional. 
I have made the change. Also tested creating the JavaScriptConfig with no "enabled" param. It does default to false. 

Thanks.

It's proven that this object couldn't be scalarized: https://twitter.com/iwan0www/status/936641774554148864, but I vaguely remember that I left this clone for some other reason, maybe it doesn't help with scalarization but does help with method inlining on the offset object. So when removing clone, regression benchmarks should be run.
Is one of the benchmarking classes already in the codebase a good way to test it?

I'm not sure, as far as I remember `TopNBenchmark` was not really representative. Instead of removing clone, I suggest to skip HistoricalXxxPrototypes when encountering FilteredOffset. It wouldn't make such queries not specialized at all, because it will fall back to GenericXxxPrototypes.

If you are OK with this I can make a patch.
I'm ok with that approach too, go for it.

This is not a new extension, but a part of the existing datasketches extension. We need to rewrite the document so that it would no longer assume datasketches means Theta sketch aggregator for approximate count-distinct. We are going to have more soon: new HLL sketch aggregator and Tuple sketch aggregator (ArrayOfDoubles). I have them almost ready, just need to brush up based on this review of Quantiles sketch aggregator.
You are right. Do you want to rewrite the document at once after merging all your patches? It sounds good to me.
👍  thanks @leventov

Wrong repo sorry
![facepalm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/487433/33510265-f830e77a-d6be-11e7-8335-b35487cb51db.jpg)
We are only doing a couple of queries per minute now and this error is happening multiple times per day.
This patch is ready for review.

I can't reproduce it on the druid api side alone, MapBasedRow should take care of transforming list values to strings, however when embedded with Tranquility (druid 0.9.2, but the avrostreamparser code was written before that release ?) it produces byte array representation of avro.Utf8 instead of java.lang.String. 
I have to create integration tests on tranquility to reproduce it.

I can also see that this line is present in `0.9.1` as well. It may be the case that back then, the error did not manifest because the config was never queries. Perhaps some newer change (e.g. https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4116) exposed this bug with losing configuration.
Fixes a regression #5132 with a low risk change (skip an optimized path for one additional case).
I think this is the last thing that should squeak into 0.11.0, I'll do the release immediately after it's merged.
@dclim thanks for the review, I have addressed your comments.
This was in fact backported.

commented in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2223#pullrequestreview-80906299

thanks for identifying the root cause.

@erikdubbelboer does it fail around the same time when the segment is handed off and realtime node is abandoning the segment.
there is a possiblity that broker forwarded the realtime node a query and right after that, segment was abandoned ... 
I had suggested @niketh to give priority to historicals and fanning out queries to take care of above scenario, that work is done in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4764 .

however, that wouldn't explain why you've started seeing this issue with increased frequency in 0.10.1 only.

@leventov sorry that this took so long, it was a very good PR thus very hard to review!
@drcrallen @himanshug @leventov @gianm @akashdw do you have further comments? If not, I'm going to merge this PR.
@niketh any update on this?
The increased frequency is probably only because we started running more periodic queries.
@niketh is on vacation.
@jon-wei ok. I'm also reviewing.

@b-slim thanks for taking time to review this PR!

> wondering what is the benefits of IntArrayList VS ArrayList?

Memory savings, IntArrayList uses `int[]` instead of `Object[]`

> this need to be called out since it is public.

To called out where? I think I made this factory method `@PublicApi` to suppress warning about this method being unnecessarily public instead of package-private. As far as I remember it was mentioned somewhere that this serde API should be considered public.

> Wondering if we can reuse other projects code, for bytebuffers IO, this pattern is fairly common and usually this kind of code can have some common bugs that are hard to see.

As I mentioned here: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4762#discussion_r145227168 I don't think this functionality could be used somewhere else in Druid. Somewhat similar is needed only possibly when making spilling in groupBy
@gianm @b-slim @drcrallen FYI included important note about the downgrade baseline, on top of the first comment in this PR.
@rahulsingh303 Struggling here as well. What was the issue?
Are you sure you Hadoop version accepts `"mapreduce.job.classloader": "true"`, you can try this one instead `mapreduce.job.user.classpath.first = true`

Hi all, any updates on this feature? Few months ago, I had posted a question regarding a similar [feature](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/4685). Is this feature under development? Is it being planned as part of an upcoming release?

Thanks.
Hi @JithinThomas, this patch is in master now so it will be available in the next release. It'll probably be numbered 0.12.0.
Hi @gianm , that's great to know! Is there an ETA on when 0.12.0 would be released? Thanks again.
@JithinThomas it will be release-branched in about 2 weeks and then released after a qa & stabilization process that typically takes a couple months.

looks like there's a conflict with this PR that removed the IOPeon class: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4762
@jon-wei thanks. Raised a PR.
:+1: after CI
Thanks for the quick review. I'll merge this PR.
+1 after travis.
Is there a way to prevent this situation in the future on type-level system or with static analysis?
I am facing the same issue with the latest release of druid-0.11 as well.
@jihoonson thanks for reviewing it ... LGTM . We actually have had this code internally reviewed and used a bit beforehand.

Maybe it's possible to have a static analysis check for ignored return values of type `AlertBuilder`. It's suspicious if one is created and then neither emitted nor assigned to a variable.

Or maybe change the API to

```java
log.makeAlert().withData("x", "y").emit("message");
```

rather than

```java
log.makeAlert("message").withData("x", "y").emit();
```

which may make it tougher to forget to emit.

Thanks @jon-wei for working on the extension and @jihoonson for reviewing.

Beyond what @jihoonson has said (especially an API to check the load status -- it's always helpful) I think we should cache the credential db on the local disk of each node, so when they start up, they can use their cache if the coordinator is not accessible. Maybe they should use their cache if they can't contact the coordinator within some amount of time. That way the coordinator being down doesn't torch the cluster completely.
@himanshug good to know. This patch is awesome. I'm looking forward to the follow-up patches.
I'm working on this.
@gianm can you log that as an improvement request issue? That sounds like the right thing to do.
I'm using Druid 0.10.0 and all the component is under UTC.
Looks like the same issue with https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/4126. Would you try again after upgrading your cluster to 0.10.1?
@jihoonson Ah, Thanks for your comment. I'll try again. Now close this issue and I'll reopen If I find same symptom out.
@dkhwangbo thanks. Please let us know if you still have the problem.
